TITLE: Manipulating Date Components with Lubridate
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates getting and setting date components using functions like month(), wday(), and year().
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
bday <- dmy("14/10/1979")
month(bday)
#> [1] 10
wday(bday, label = TRUE)
#> [1] Sun
#> Levels: Sun < Mon < Tue < Wed < Thu < Fri < Sat

year(bday) <- 2016
wday(bday, label = TRUE)
#> [1] Fri
#> Levels: Sun < Mon < Tue < Wed < Thu < Fri < Sat
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Lubridate Package in R
DESCRIPTION: Shows different methods to install the lubridate package, including through tidyverse, direct installation, or from GitHub using devtools.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
# The easiest way to get lubridate is to install the whole tidyverse:
install.packages("tidyverse")

# Alternatively, install just lubridate:
install.packages("lubridate")

# Or the development version from GitHub:
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("tidyverse/lubridate")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Month Addition Example in R using lubridate
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the difference between using %m+% operator vs standard + operator for month arithmetic with dates, showing how %m+% handles month end dates differently.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
ymd("2010-01-31") %m+% months(1)
# "2010-02-28 UTC"

ymd("2010-01-31") + months(1)
# "2010-03-03 UTC"

ymd("2010-03-31") %m-% months(1)
# "2010-02-28 UTC"

ymd("2010-01-31") - months(1)
# "2010-03-03 UTC"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Lubridate Library in R
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates loading the lubridate library while suppressing conflict warnings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
library(lubridate, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Parsing Dates with Lubridate Functions
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to parse dates using lubridate's intuitive date parsing functions ymd() and mdy().
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
ymd(20101215)
#> [1] "2010-12-15"
mdy("4/1/17")
#> [1] "2017-04-01"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting lubridate verbose option in R
DESCRIPTION: Code snippet showing how to control lubridate's parsing and estimation messages by setting a global option.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/NEWS.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
options(lubridate.verbose = TRUE) # Turn parsing messages on
options(lubridate.verbose = FALSE) # Turn estimation and coercion messages off
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Handling Time Zones with Lubridate
DESCRIPTION: Shows time zone manipulation using with_tz() and force_tz() functions to change timezone display and actual time.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
time <- ymd_hms("2010-12-13 15:30:30")
time
#> [1] "2010-12-13 15:30:30 UTC"

# Changes printing
with_tz(time, "America/Chicago")
#> [1] "2010-12-13 09:30:30 CST"

# Changes time
force_tz(time, "America/Chicago")
#> [1] "2010-12-13 15:30:30 CST"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Interval Integer Division with Different Time Objects
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates division of an interval by different time objects. Shows that intervals cannot be divided by intervals, but can be divided by durations (resulting in 151 days) and periods (resulting in 5 months).
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/tests/testthat/test-ops-integer-division.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
int %/% int
Error: Incompatible classes: <Interval> / <Interval>

int %/% dur
[1] 151

int %/% per
[1] 5
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Duration Integer Division with Different Time Objects
DESCRIPTION: Shows integer division with a duration as the numerator. Durations can be divided by other durations, but operations with intervals or periods result in errors due to class incompatibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/tests/testthat/test-ops-integer-division.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
dur %/% int
Error: Incompatible classes: <Duration> / <Interval>

dur %/% dur
[1] 1

dur %/% per
Error: Incompatible classes: <Duration> %/% <Period>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Time Objects in Lubridate
DESCRIPTION: Creates sample objects for testing: an interval spanning 5 months, a duration of 1 day, and a period of 1 month. These objects will be used to demonstrate integer division operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/tests/testthat/test-ops-integer-division.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
int <- ymd("2010-01-01") %--% ymd("2010-06-01")
dur <- ddays(1)
per <- months(1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing vctrs Combination and Casting for Lubridate Types in R
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet tests the behavior of vctrs methods when attempting to combine or cast between Period, Duration, and Interval types from the lubridate package. It verifies that appropriate error messages are generated for incompatible operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/tests/testthat/_snaps/vctrs.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: R
CODE:
```
# no common type when mixing Period/Duration/Interval
vec_ptype2(period(), duration())
vec_ptype2(duration(), period())
vec_ptype2(period(), interval())
vec_ptype2(interval(), period())
vec_ptype2(duration(), interval())
vec_ptype2(interval(), duration())

# can't cast between Period/Duration/Interval
vec_cast(period(), duration())
vec_cast(duration(), period())
vec_cast(period(), interval())
vec_cast(interval(), period())
vec_cast(duration(), interval())
vec_cast(interval(), duration())

# Period default ptype2 method falls through to `vec_default_ptype2()`
vec_ptype2(period(), 1)
vec_ptype2(1, period())

# Period default cast method falls through to `vec_default_cast()`
vec_cast(period(), 1)
vec_cast(1, period())

# Duration default ptype2 method falls through to `vec_default_ptype2()`
vec_ptype2(duration(), 1)
vec_ptype2(1, duration())

# Duration default cast method falls through to `vec_default_cast()`
vec_cast(duration(), 1)
vec_cast(1, duration())

# Interval default ptype2 method falls through to `vec_default_ptype2()`
vec_ptype2(interval(), 1)
vec_ptype2(1, interval())

# Interval default cast method falls through to `vec_default_cast()`
vec_cast(interval(), 1)
vec_cast(1, interval())
```

TITLE: Period Integer Division with Different Time Objects
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates integer division with a period as the numerator. Periods can only be divided by other periods, while operations with intervals or durations result in errors due to class incompatibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/tests/testthat/test-ops-integer-division.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: r
CODE:
```
per %/% int
Error: Incompatible classes: <Period> / <Interval>

per %/% dur
Error: Incompatible classes: <Period> %/% <Duration>

per %/% per
[1] 1
```

TITLE: Terminal Interaction Notice for GNU GPL Licensed Programs
DESCRIPTION: A short notice to display when a GPL-licensed program with terminal interaction starts in interactive mode. This briefly states copyright information and mentions the absence of warranty.
SOURCE: https://github.com/tidyverse/lubridate/blob/main/LICENSE.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
lubridate Copyright (C) 2019 Mara Averick
This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type 'show w'.
This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it
under certain conditions; type 'show c' for details.
```
